body:
`/` is technically a meta-character in HTML, but it's not necessary to escape it as long as you're escaping `<` and `&`.

If you're really worried about someone sneaking a closing tag through without `<`, escape U+226E which denormalizes to [`<` followed by a `/`](http://www.unicode.org/charts/normalization/chart_Symbol-Math.html) and the full-width U+FF1C and U+FE64.
